newsitem.title: UK: Strategist Tinker quits James Capel to join UBS.
newsitem.headline: Strategist Tinker quits James Capel to join UBS.

text.p: Equity strategist Mark Tinker has quit HSBC James Capel to join rival UBS, the Swiss-owned brokerage said on Thursday.
In a statement, UBS said Tinker would have special responsibility for UK strategy within its pan-European equity strategy group.
He will succeed Tim Brown, who will assume a new role as a managing director within the UBS global equity strategy team with responsibility for creating a new research product on accountancy issues.
Tinker, for three years part of the equity strategy team at Capel, will report to Mark Howdle, UBS head of pan-European equity strategy.
Howdle said Tinker would place UK strategy in a European context in line with a reorganisation of UBS equity coverage aimed at ending the division between UK and continental European research.
"We are in a process of bringing together continental and UK research into a merged pan-European structure," he said.
"It is driven by our clients. Virtually all our U.S. and Japanese clients look at their European investments as an indivisible entity and to have two separate product lines makes no sense."
